content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Check the Apple Store for the availability of the latest iPhone model and schedule an in-store pickup at the nearest Apple Store for January 10, 2024.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The latest iPhone model (iPhone 17 Pro) is featured on the homepage. To check availability and schedule in-store pickup, I should explore the iPhone section for purchasing and pickup options.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The latest iPhone model, iPhone 17 Pro, is available and has a “New” label. To check availability and schedule an in-store pickup, the next step should be to select the iPhone 17 Pro so I can proceed to the purchase or pickup options.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the iPhone 17 Pro product page, but there are no visible options for checking availability or scheduling in-store pickup. I should scroll down to find purchase or pickup options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pre-order" button for the iPhone 17 Pro is available, indicating that the device can be reserved. Clicking "Pre-order" should lead to options for purchase and possibly scheduling in-store pickup.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pre-order iPhone 17 Pro" page is displayed, but there's no visible option for pickup or selecting a store yet. To proceed, I should scroll down to find the options for selecting a model and possibly store pickup.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is an option on the top right labeled "Pick up from Store," which is likely related to in-store pickup. Selecting this option should allow checking availability at nearby Apple Stores and scheduling pickup.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen now offers color choices for the iPhone 17 Pro, which is the next customization step before choosing store/location and scheduling pickup. I should select a color to proceed with the order and reveal further steps for scheduling in-store pickup. 
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Silver color is now selected for the iPhone 17 Pro. The next step should involve choosing storage size or configuration to proceed toward the pickup scheduling. I need to scroll down to access further purchasing steps.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.78
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The storage selection screen is visible, and to move toward selecting pickup, I need to choose a storage option for the iPhone 17 Pro. Selecting the base 256GB model (usually most available) is a logical next step.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The 256GB storage has been selected. The next step is likely further down the page, possibly asking about carrier or trade-in, before showing pickup schedule options. I should scroll down to continue the process.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Apple Trade-In section is displayed, where I can choose to trade in an old device or proceed with "No trade-in." To keep things simple and move forward to scheduling the pickup, I should select "No trade-in."
Action: Click [5]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: "No trade-in" is selected, which should allow me to proceed with the order process. The next step (such as carrier or pickup options) is probably lower on the page. I need to scroll down further to move toward the in-store pickup scheduling options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The payment options for purchasing the iPhone 17 Pro are visible. To simplify the process and move toward scheduling the in-store pickup, selecting the "Buy" option (full price) is straightforward and avoids extra approvals.

Thought: The "Buy" payment option is selected. The next step involves choosing a carrier. Selecting a carrier, such as AT&T, should enable me to proceed further, possibly to shipping or pickup options.
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.92

Thought: The page shows "In-store availability on 9.19," which indicates the first available in-store pickup date for the iPhone 17 Pro is September 19. However, the task requires scheduling for January 10, 2024. I need to continue with the pickup process to try to select the desired pickup date.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.94

Thought: The AppleCare options are now shown. Completion of this section is required before proceeding, so selecting "No AppleCare coverage" is the simplest way to continue toward the pickup scheduling page.

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[3]: <button> "Get 3% Daily Cash with Apple Card";	[4]: "2–3 weeks";	[5]: "Free Shipping";	[6]: <button> "Get delivery dates";	[7]: <button> "";

content:
Thought: The summary section shows "Pickup: In-store availability on 9.19," suggesting that currently, the earliest available pickup date is September 19, not January 10, 2024. There is no visible option to schedule further in advance. I should scroll further to confirm if there is an option to select or schedule a later date for in-store pickup.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.98

This may provide a final opportunity to select or change the pickup date and location, but prior steps only showed September 19 as the first available date for in-store pickup, not January 10, 2024.
